data.title: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot
data.meta_description: MemphisTigers.org:  The #1 Board for Memphis Tigers sports on the internet.
data.text:
Post: #24

RE: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot

(07-30-2021 12:10 PM)macgar32 Wrote: Has he ever coached before?

He worked for the Pistons for the 2013–14 season, but was not rehired to the staff of new coach Stan Van Gundy following that season. On March 8, 2019, Wallace was introduced as the new boys varsity basketball head coach at Charles E. Jordan High School in Durham, North Carolina.

Post: #25

RE: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot

When I was in college at Memphis I was downtown when Pistons and Sheed were leaving for shootaround. I was the only person outside the Peabody. When I asked for an autograph he said “ I don’t sign for your type wrong color.”

Post: #28

RE: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot

People change you know. They might grow up being ridiculed for their race and they might get angry/bitter/lash out at all.... but they change when they meet better folks.

Ja Morant and his family were insulted and verbally abused in Salt Lake City but he did not get angry. He gets it. His response was awesome.

We all need to be the better folks! lol

(This post was last modified: 07-31-2021 11:42 AM by snowtiger.)

Post: #36

RE: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot

I’ve met every one from Hank Aaron to MJ to pretty much everyone in the NBA in last 20 years. Rasheed Wallace, Lebron and Othella Herrington of all people were the only ones who were awful towards me. I’m a Tiger fan and will root for the players and for Penny too but I will never root for anything Rasheed Wallace

Post: #37

RE: Rasheed Wallace linked to third assistant spot

(07-30-2021 10:32 PM)UMTiger02 Wrote: When I was in college at Memphis I was downtown when Pistons and Sheed were leaving for shootaround. I was the only person outside the Peabody. When I asked for an autograph he said “ I don’t sign for your type wrong color.”

I always thought he was a punk when he was in college. He really messed up the chemistry of what was probably the most talented basketball team I ever saw, defending national champions adding (3) McDonalds All Americans--he was almost certainly the most talented player on the team. Of that freshman class of ACC bigs, Joe Smith (1st pick in 1995 NBA draft), Tim Duncan (1st pick in 1997 NBA draft), I thought Rasheed was the most naturally talented.

If he's not being recruited as an assistant by his former college teammate, the coach at Vanderbilt, that should tell us something.

(07-30-2021 10:32 PM)UMTiger02 Wrote: When I was in college at Memphis I was downtown when Pistons and Sheed were leaving for shootaround. I was the only person outside the Peabody. When I asked for an autograph he said “ I don’t sign for your type wrong color.”

I always thought he was a punk when he was in college. He really messed up the chemistry of what was probably the most talented basketball team I ever saw, defending national champions adding (3) McDonalds All Americans--he was almost certainly the most talented player on the team. Of that freshman class of ACC bigs, Joe Smith (1st pick in 1995 NBA draft), Tim Duncan (1st pick in 1997 NBA draft), I thought Rasheed was the most naturally talented.

If he's not being recruited as an assistant by his former college teammate, the coach at Vanderbilt, that should tell us something.

BTW, while UNC had (3) MDAA's in that class (Rasheed, Stackhouse, McGinnis), Memphis had 2.
